result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose Rogelio Echeverria was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to extended supervision in 13CF58

miscConds.notes: Defendant to obtain/maintain full time employment or school or combination of both equivalent to full time as approved by agent.  Cannot quit without approval of agent.

Defendant not ordered to pay DNA surcharge.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name and must take as prescribed.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

No association with known drug dealers, known drug users or their residences.

Not be present where controlled substances are illegally consumed or sold.

Defendant to obtain housing approved by agent.

Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
